p: The basic reproduction number, R 0, was also sensitive to temperature, as it includes the same temperature-dependent random variables as the generation interval. At low temperatures, increases in temperature caused a steady increase in R 0 due to a shortening extrinsic incubation period and increasing biting frequency ( Fig 2A and 2C). Beyond a peak temperature of 32.5°C, R 0 decreased rapidly with increasing temperatures due to rapidly increasing mosquito mortality ( Fig 2A and 2C). This result contrasted with a lower peak temperature (~29°C) that was obtained in our analysis (not shown in figures) under an assumption that biting rate did not depend on temperature.
